sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: A circle has a radius of 5 cm. What is the exact perimeter of the circle?
message_2:
The perimeter (or circumference) of a circle is given by the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius.

In this case, the radius (r) is 5 cm. So, we can plug this value into the formula:

C = 2π(5 cm)
C = 10π cm

The exact perimeter of the circle is 10π cm.
